title: What do you think of Basecamp's work culture?
body: httpsbasecampcomaboutjobs  some bits that stand out to me  gt we value a calm company and deliberate concerted effort youll have a lot fewer meetings a lot less email and a lot less interruption turns out 8 hours are plenty of time to get work done when you dont slice your day into tiny work moments  gt every three years employees are eligible to take a onemonthlong paid sabbatical  gt 40 hour work week  work is a marathon not a sprint we regularly stick to 40 hours a week with the occasional emergency or onceeveryfewyears special push demanding more  gt 32 hour 4day summer work week  may 1 through august 31 we work 4 days a week for a total of 32hour weeks  gt whatever hardware software or services you need to do your job are always 100 on us no red tape no questions asked  gt paid parental leave  when you welcome a new baby basecamp encourages you to take up to 16 weeks leave as primary caregiver and up to 6 weeks leave as secondary caregiver at 100 paid salary primary or secondary caregivers can choose to take an additional 8 weeks unpaid leave  gt vacations and paid holidays  basecamp offers 3 weeks of paid vacation a few extra personal days and a few national holidays every year this is a guideline so dont sweat a few extra days  gt no office traps  we dont offer things like foosball tables catered meals in the office and other perks designed to keep you at work for all of your waking hours we want you to put in 8 quality hours then go live your life rest and recharge so you can come back fresh to do it again  what a shame that i dont know of literally any other companies that have a culture like this

title: Work should not be more important than your life

for our purposes here background information her memorial is this friday and i requested the day off thankfully it was granted but im having a difficult time grappling with having to work this entire week with my entire family in town people i see maybe once every few years or so i should have taken the whole week off knowing full well i would be a wreck this is valentines week however and i work in the produce department which covers floral this is arguably the biggest week of the year for us even if i had requested that time i would not have gotten it   i have been thinking a lot about this particular subject since her death as coming into work has been extremely taxing as i work for a company that prides itself on customer service im not really allowed to express any other emotion than obsequious happiness but i am not happy in fact im downright miserable this feeling the subject of this post really hit me hard this tuesday my cousin had just gotten into town for the service and we went to lunch before i had to go to work it is the peak of season here in florida and i was rushing to finish lunch so i could get to work on timei didntand when i clocked in i wasnt in a particularly jovial mood having just powered through a lunch with a family member i enjoy the company of but almost never get to see just so i could had the pleasure of working for 8 hours anyway i had a thought upon clocking in and walking into our cooler which essentially came down to this the company i work at doesnt care about any of this the particulars of my life the petty travails of its employees are nothing compared to that of the singular drive for profit i suddenly realizednot for the first time but for the first time in a visceral waythat work and life are utterly incompatible the world of work is not the real world but ironically it is the one we inhabit the most everything about work is fake plastic a charade of pretend emotions and pretenses just so people will be slightly more comfortable buying groceries here instead of walmart a grand illusion constructed for the everexpanding acquisition of more monetary wealth and the paltry lives of the gears that make up the machine value of our company for our stockholders after all its right there in the mission statement there are some other bulletpoints in there too but they arent as important as that one and its the only one that matters anywhere not just at this company its like we live behind a mirror and what ought to be meaningful and real is reflected back at us as threadbare unimportant the dark reflection of a grim specter refracted through the dizzying haze of surplus value production   i work on saturday the day after my grandmothers memorial service i work at 7 in the fucking morning no time for silent title: 21 years of life in a mountain wilderness - I wanted to share this here...
body: video httpswwwyoutubecomwatchvglp2lnhxviehttpswwwyoutubecomwatchvglp2lnhxvie  from the description    storyline  their home most certainly has a view ramiz palos and his wife zemina fled the hardships of urban life in bosnia as soon as the country had emerged from a 4yearwar two decades ago   they choose to live on mount vlasic in central bosnia at 1300 meters above sea level separated by kilometres of dirt road from the nearest inhabited place   palos says he is not a recluse and was not looking for an escape from traumatic memories instead he says he wanted to take control of his life  after 21 years of primal existence in the wilderness palos feels in control and happy insisting he would never return to civilisation  i had several reasons to move here i came here to secure means for existence but also to live an exciting life to not have a boring life he says   life in the wilderness has many challenges but palos insists embracing it was easier and more productive than if he had waited for the government to create a job for him  people here in bosnia are too willing to surrender responsibility for their own life to somebody else they are not thinking people need to think to come up with ways to find work for themselves i dont have to worry about the work of the government or anyone else he says  while he sometimes has to fight off bears and wolves and to endure pouring rains winter storms and strong winds palos has an abundance of food fresh air and a warm home  you need to know how to behave in nature because we get heavy rains winter storms and strong winds you need to know how to behave in such circumstances he says  sometimes it gets so cold that i cannot leave home for two months but i have enough food and everything else i need so it does not matter winter comes and goes  with an unemployment rate of close to 30 percent finding a job in bosnia can be hard and close to a fifth of the countrys population lives in poverty  the country is failing to fully capitalise on the good climatic conditions and an abundance of fertile land that make it one of the most favourable spots for farming in southern europe  but aleksandra nikolic from the sarajevo faculty of agriculture and food science believes that a growing number of bosnians are recognising the advantages of rural life  agriculture is a way of life it is no longer identified with the image of an exhausted man farming a rough patch of land in the middle of nowhere with the help of emaciated farming animals she says agriculture is a sector of economy that helps people in local communities to weather the periods of financial economic political or any other crisis by securing a source of income that helps them get through hard times palos might be the best example of that when he first moved into the mountains in 1996 he lived in an old van and then in a makeshift tent but after just a few months he had built a simple house for himself and was joined by his wife  they still live in the house with no running water and off the electricity grid but they grow their own vegetables and corn raise goats and farm fish in the wild mountain river palos used local wood and stone to build his barn hatching tanks and the watermill where he grinds his corn  from time to time palos ventures into the nearest town to sell extra produce to urban dwellers and purchase essential supplies that he and his wife cannot produce for themselves

title: I'd like to share some thoughts about meaningful work

well i wont go into much detail for privacy reasons sorry  i am a personal assistant to a disabled person now i dont know if this is common outside the nordic countries so ill explain if someone with a longterm disability requires regular assistance from another person for daily tasks  not medical care and not looking after  its possible to hire someone to come help you out with whatever you need my employer has a physical disability affecting mobility and their own life that they live so i am just there when needed for logistical support so to speak it allows my employer to focus on their own life rather than meshing the role of assistant with friends or family i dont have any opinion on something like whether anyone prefers an employee to a relative taking this role my point is more that this option is available to people here and im not trying to toot my own horn here anyone with mobility in their hands could do this work so im not special but i think that this particular position is pretty cool  so im very motivated when i go to work it helps that my employer and i get along well but the fact of the matter is that this is work that needs to happen in an ideal world in my opinion disabled people would be not bred out nor segregated nor considered a burden so this is work that absolutely needs to be done and an option that absolutely needs to exist in order for everyone to have selfdetermination compare to some childcare jobs i have had where the parents and kids expressed the desire to actually stay home but for serious financial reasons couldnt that was so frustrating to me and left me with a lot of dissatisfaction in my work  the other thing i like about my job now is that this comes at no cost to my employer they are the one who put out the job listing interviewed me hired me and who sends my hour log to the city but it is the city who pays my salary to speak of the salary it is enough for just me to live without much stress but its likely that other people title: Book recommendations
